@vaccinated well said!

This is a story about change, time, loss & notalgia ... It's somewhat unusual in that the vanished & irretrievable past is seen not from the distant vantage of age, but in the real time here-and-now present ... Over the course of 20 pages, the protagonist begins to understand that things change and vanish even as we experience them, that to understand life is to accept the inevitability of loss ... He will not get bacl together with her, and if he did, things between them would not be the same ... That's the whole point

After reading for 3 times i started to think something new : The plot isnt really sad at all and i can proof it . The MC even has a future and a good chance whith his girl , the only thing that is a true problem is the time far from her but probably this distance wont change anything because this always happens to they . What is really sad isnt the plot but the way the MC deals with the changes in his life . What we truly have here ,ma boys  , is the rise of a man. And so i think it desnt need a part2 because it made me thing they will stay together .

Oh well... I didn't even popped a boner, my head was already at peak stimulation, trying to remember the good old times when I had a house in the countryside in which I went every weekend. It was bought and destroyed and we never returned to that place. I had my first love in the little 100 ppl village (but we were 7, unlike those we only kissed). I never excepted a fap session to dig a hole in my mind and put me in complete lethargy for a straight hour

Here is my thought. If you make a 20 pg doujinshi, know your purpose. Is the purpose to put in some melancholy slice of life, or is it about some fun youth times and what not? In the world of fantasy you are the shaper of destiny, and if deep down in your heart you want a happy ending for these kids, then what's stopping you? Life, ethics, reality, and people can be whatever you want, yet you choose this? We understand this well enough in life, all of us do at some point. Give us soup for the soul, the one that will fill us up and make us warm, and when we lay in bed we will sleep so peacefully. This doujinshi... it is what we know and want, but it isn't what we need. The doujinshi that bridges life with mature content has yet to arrive, and if none of you will be the one to do it then give me the pen and I will show you how it's done.
